benchmark_details.name: BattleAgentBench
benchmark_details.overview: BattleAgentBench is a benchmark for evaluating the cooperation and competition capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in multi-agent systems, defining seven sub-stages across three difficulty levels and conducting fine-grained evaluations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the collaborative and competitive capabilities of Large Language Models in a multi-agent environment through structured gaming scenarios.

data.source: Developed as a new evaluation benchmark

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the agent's navigation capabilities and successful task completions.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the level of performance in navigating scenarios and achieving objectives.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated across various stages with multiple runs to ensure consistency.
